wikipedia_page.main: William Philip Eadie (born 1882) was a Scottish footballer born in Greenock who played for Greenock Overton, Morton, Manchester City and Derby County as a centre-half.He played for Manchester City between 1906 and 1914, appearing 184 times and scoring 6 goals in league matches. He later made 31 appearances for Derby County.

response: On June 11, 2021, wrestler Lanny Poffo posted online that Eadie had been taken to the hospital with heart problems due to a bad reaction to the COVID-19 vaccine. "Please pray for the health of my friend, Bill Eadie, better known to the fans as Axe of the Demolition. His heart had a bad reaction to the COVID-19 vaccine." Poffo said.PWInsider also confirmed the news and that several wrestling legends have sent in the news and are asking fans for their thoughts and prayers.

link_mentions.page: List of Manchester City F.C. players

response: * Bill Eadie (footballer) (William Philip Eadie, 1882–?), Scottish football centre-half
